signals.headline: DeepSeek V4 imminent: coding-focused model with 1M+ context targeting mid-February launch
signals.source: The Motley Fool, Feb 11 2026 — https://www.fool.com/investing/2026/02/11/deepseek-v4-is-coming-this-month-why-it-could-ratt/; The Information (Jan 2026 report)
signals.data_point: DeepSeek V4 targets ~Feb 17 launch. Internal testing reportedly shows it outperforming Claude 3.5 Sonnet and GPT-4o on coding benchmarks. Uses Engram conditional memory for 1M+ token context. Runs on consumer hardware (dual RTX 4090s or single RTX 5090).
signals.relevance: If confirmed, DeepSeek V4 would further compress the frontier AI gap between US and Chinese labs, especially in coding — the highest-value enterprise AI use case. Consumer-grade hardware compatibility accelerates global diffusion and undermines compute-moat assumptions.

signals.headline: Anthropic releases Claude Opus 4.6 with 1M-token context; software stocks react
signals.source: CNN Business, Feb 5 2026 — https://www.cnn.com/2026/02/05/tech/anthropic-opus-update-software-stocks
signals.data_point: Claude Opus 4.6 launched with 1M-token context in beta, matched top score on FrontierMath Tiers 1-3 (first for Anthropic). Outperforms GPT-5.2 on GDPval knowledge-work benchmark spanning 44 occupations across top 9 GDP industries.
signals.relevance: GDPval benchmark signals AI frontier models are now being measured against real economic output tasks, not abstract benchmarks. Direct implications for knowledge-work automation across finance, legal, and professional services sectors.

signals.headline: OpenAI releases GPT-5.3-Codex: first model 'instrumental in creating itself'
signals.source: MarketingProfs AI Update, Feb 6 2026; OpenTools.ai, Feb 11 2026
signals.data_point: GPT-5.3-Codex used early versions to debug its own training pipeline and manage deployment. OpenAI also launched Frontier orchestration platform for transitioning AI from pilots to enterprise production.
signals.relevance: Self-referential AI development (model assists in its own training) is a capability milestone that accelerates the improvement cycle. Frontier platform signals OpenAI pivoting hard toward enterprise monetization after years of consumer-first approach.

signals.headline: Physical AI robotics funding surges as digital AI markets face correction
signals.source: Robotics and Automation News, Feb 9 2026 — https://roboticsandautomationnews.com/2026/02/09/physical-ai-robotics-draws-millions-in-funding-as-digital-markets-face-correction/98812/
signals.data_point: Robotics startups raised $13.8B in 2025, up 77% from $7.8B in 2024, exceeding the 2021 venture peak of $13.1B. Capital rotating from digital AI into physical/frontier AI. Skild AI raised $1.4B at $14B valuation (Jan 14); RobCo secured $100M for autonomous industrial robotics.
signals.relevance: Capital rotation from software AI to physical AI signals market believes embodied intelligence is the next value frontier. Directly impacts manufacturing, logistics, and construction labor markets — sectors with acute labor shortages.

signals.headline: R3 Robotics secures EUR 20M for automated EV battery disassembly at scale
signals.source: Oetker Collection press release, Feb 5 2026 — https://oetker-collection.com/wp-content/uploads/2026/02/EN-R3-Robotics-Series-A-Press-Release-2026-02-05-1.pdf
signals.data_point: EUR 20M in combined financing to industrialize automated disassembly of electric vehicle systems at scale. Series A funding round.
signals.relevance: Robotics entering EV recycling/circular economy marks convergence of automation + energy transition. As EV batteries reach end-of-life at scale (2026-2030), automated disassembly becomes critical infrastructure. Creates new NAICS categories at intersection of waste management and advanced manufacturing.

signals.headline: AI coding adoption reaches 84% of developers; 41% of all code now AI-generated
signals.source: Multiple sources aggregated by index.dev, Panto AI, netcorp — Feb 2026 data
signals.data_point: 84% of developers use AI tools, 51% daily. 41% of all code is AI-generated. Almost half of companies have 50%+ AI-generated code (up from 20% at start of year). BUT: 46% of developers actively distrust AI tool accuracy, only 3% report high trust. RCT showed 19% net slowdown for experienced open-source contributors.
signals.relevance: Adoption-trust divergence is a critical signal: tools are ubiquitous but trust is low. The productivity paradox (adoption up, measured slowdown in controlled trials) suggests the transformation is happening through workflow change rather than pure speed gains. Fear friction (T25) is structurally embedded.

signals.headline: Agentic AI reaches semiconductor production: NVIDIA uses agent-driven workflows to design Feynman architecture
signals.source: FinancialContent/TokenRing, Feb 6 2026; NVIDIA Newsroom
signals.data_point: NVIDIA utilizing agent-driven workflows to design upcoming Feynman architecture to handle 2,000-watt chip power-delivery constraints. NVIDIA also released Nemotron 3 Nano (open weights) for agentic applications, with Super/Ultra models coming H1 2026. 85% of orgs want to become 'agentic enterprises' within 3 years but 76% say business processes aren't ready.
signals.relevance: AI designing its own hardware infrastructure is a recursive capability acceleration. The 85% aspiration vs 76% unreadiness gap mirrors fear friction — organizations want transformation but structural barriers persist. Nemotron open weights democratize agentic AI development.

signals.headline: Enterprise AI exits pilot purgatory: 66% report productivity gains, 40% of apps to have AI agents by year-end
signals.source: Deloitte State of AI in Enterprise 2026; Gartner Aug 2025 prediction; index.dev Feb 2026
signals.data_point: 66% of orgs report productivity gains from AI. Workers save 40-60 min/day (heavy users 10+ hrs/week). 40% of enterprise apps will feature task-specific AI agents by end of 2026 (up from <5% in 2025). 74% of companies plan agentic AI deployment within 2 years. Top barriers: lack of skilled talent, data issues, weak governance.
signals.relevance: The shift from 5% to 40% AI-agent-embedded enterprise applications in a single year is among the fastest enterprise technology transitions in history. This restructures the entire IT services sector and accelerates professional services automation.

signals.headline: Federal workforce hits lowest level since 1966: 322,000 departed in first year of DOGE
signals.source: RedState, Feb 11 2026 — https://redstate.com/ben-smith/2026/02/11/federal-employment-hits-lowest-level-since-1966-as-trump-doge-cut-government-workforce-n2199059; Cato Institute
signals.data_point: Federal civilian workforce down 9% (322,000 departures) to 2,686,000 — lowest since LBJ era. USAID workforce cut 92% (4,800 to 378). 55 contracts terminated in last 3 days with $1.6B ceiling value. Despite workforce cuts, spending increased by hundreds of billions due to debt service, defense, and entitlements.
signals.relevance: Largest peacetime federal workforce reduction in US history directly restructures government contractor ecosystem (NAICS 5416, 5614, 5413). The spending-paradox (cut workers, spending still rises) reveals structural fiscal constraints that are independent of efficiency efforts. Geographic concentration of federal employment in DC metro creates localized economic shock.

signals.headline: India AI Impact Summit opens Feb 16-20: first Global South AI governance summit with 15-20 heads of state
signals.source: PIB India (Press Information Bureau); India AI Impact Summit official site — https://impact.indiaai.gov.in/
signals.data_point: Summit at Bharat Mandapam, New Delhi, Feb 16-20. Expected: 15-20 heads of government, 50+ international ministers, 40+ global CEOs. AI Compendium release Feb 17 with real-world AI application case studies. Seven thematic Chakras (working groups). Leaders' Declaration is key output.
signals.relevance: First major AI governance summit hosted in Global South signals power shift in AI regulation discourse away from US/EU axis. India positioning as bridge between advanced AI nations and developing world. Any governance frameworks adopted here could shape AI deployment rules for 3B+ population across Global South.

signals.headline: EDPB/EDPS adopt joint opinion on Digital Omnibus: support AI Act delay but warn on GDPR weakening
signals.source: EDPS, Feb 10 2026 — https://www.edps.europa.eu/data-protection/our-work/publications/edps-edpb-joint-opinions/2026-02-10-edpb-edps-joint-opinion-digital-omnibus_en
signals.data_point: Joint Opinion adopted Feb 10. Supports simplification but raises concerns about proposed changes to GDPR personal data definition going 'too far.' Questions whether AI Act high-risk system deadline delay (up to 16 months, to Dec 2027) is necessary. Proposal to reduce admin burden 25% for all businesses, 35% for SMEs by 2029.
signals.relevance: EU AI regulatory timeline remains uncertain — delay of high-risk AI system rules from Aug 2026 to potentially Dec 2027 creates a longer compliance window but also regulatory ambiguity. GDPR definition changes could fundamentally alter data governance across all AI applications in EU. SME burden reduction target signals EU recognizes competitiveness gap with US/China.

signals.headline: US hosts inaugural Critical Minerals Ministerial: 54 nations, Project Vault $10B reserve, FORGE alliance launched
signals.source: US State Department, Feb 4 2026 — https://www.state.gov/releases/office-of-the-spokesperson/2026/02/2026-critical-minerals-ministerial; CNBC Feb 5; Al Jazeera Feb 4
signals.data_point: 54 nations + EU Commission, 43 ministers attended. New bilateral mineral frameworks signed with EU, Japan, Mexico + 12 others. Project Vault: $10B EXIM loan (largest in EXIM history) for domestic strategic mineral reserve. Forum on Resource Geostrategic Engagement (FORGE) launched to counter China's mineral leverage.
signals.relevance: US building formal counter-China mineral alliance is a structural geopolitical shift. $10B Project Vault creates new domestic mineral stockpiling infrastructure. FORGE alliance explicitly frames critical minerals as geostrategic competition. Direct impact on semiconductor, defense, energy transition supply chains.

signals.headline: US-China tariff truce holds through Nov 2026 but effective rates remain at 47.5% on Chinese goods
signals.source: Penn Wharton Budget Model, Feb 3 2026 — https://budgetmodel.wharton.upenn.edu/issues/2026/2/3/effective-tariff-rates-and-revenues-updated-february-3-2026; PIIE; Tax Foundation
signals.data_point: US average tariff on Chinese goods: 47.5% (covering 100% of goods). China's retaliatory tariffs on US goods: 31.9% (100% coverage). Nov 2025 truce extended to Nov 10, 2026 (reduced April 2025 escalation from 125% to 10%). Average tax increase per US household: $1,300 in 2026.
signals.relevance: Tariff truce provides temporary stability but underlying 47.5% rate represents structural decoupling. November 2026 expiration creates policy cliff risk. $1,300/household cost reshapes consumer spending patterns and accelerates reshoring/friend-shoring investment decisions across manufacturing sectors.

signals.headline: AUKUS ITAR exemption finalized but Excluded Technology List remains unreformed
signals.source: DLA Piper, Jan 2026; Federal Register Jan 22 2026; CSIS analysis
signals.data_point: State Dept finalized AUKUS ITAR exemption (Dec 30, 2025) streamlining defense trade among US/UK/Australia. FY2026 NDAA allocates $27.2B for naval shipbuilding (1 Columbia-class, 2 Virginia-class submarines). BUT Excluded Technology List unchanged, blocking license-free transfer on hypersonics and unmanned systems. NATO DIANA launched 2026 cohort with 150 innovators.
signals.relevance: AUKUS implementation gap (exemption finalized but key technologies still excluded) reveals tension between alliance-building and technology control. $27.2B naval shipbuilding sustains submarine industrial base. NATO DIANA 150-innovator cohort expands defense-tech ecosystem beyond traditional contractors.

signals.headline: Global data center energy consumption report projects massive demand surge
signals.source: GlobeNewsWire, Feb 10 2026 — https://www.globenewswire.com/news-release/2026/02/10/3235490/0/en/Global-Data-Center-Energy-Consumption-Trends-and-Projections.html; BloombergNEF; Data Center Knowledge
signals.data_point: Data center industry leased 15+ GW in 2025 but almost none came online — all scheduled for late 2026/2027. US data center power demand could reach 106 GW by 2035 (BloombergNEF). xAI plans $20B, 2 GW data center in Southaven, MS (operations starting Feb 2026). EIA cut 2026 power generation forecast by more than one percentage point.
signals.relevance: The 15 GW leased-but-not-online gap creates a massive power delivery cliff in late 2026/2027. 106 GW by 2035 would require roughly doubling current US data center capacity every 3-4 years. EIA forecast cut suggests grid buildout is not keeping pace with contractual commitments. This is the central energy bottleneck for AI scaling.

signals.headline: Meta signs largest tech-nuclear deal in history: 6.6 GW across Vistra, TerraPower, and Oklo
signals.source: Meta official blog, Jan 9 2026 — https://about.fb.com/news/2026/01/meta-nuclear-energy-projects-power-american-ai-leadership/; TechCrunch; CNBC
signals.data_point: 6.6 GW total: Vistra provides immediate access to Perry, Davis-Besse (OH) and Beaver Valley (PA) plants (late 2026); Oklo reactors online ~2030, scaling to 1.2 GW; TerraPower reactors ~2032, scaling to 2.6 GW + 1.2 GW storage. Largest single tech company nuclear commitment ever.
signals.relevance: Meta's 6.6 GW commitment exceeds the total nuclear capacity of most countries. Validates nuclear as THE baseload solution for hyperscale AI. Three-vendor strategy (existing plants + two different advanced reactor designs) hedges technology risk. Sets pricing benchmark for future tech-nuclear deals.

signals.headline: Holtec submits SMR-300 construction permit application to NRC for twin reactors at Palisades
signals.source: NRC press release; ANS Nuclear Newswire; Neutron Bytes, Jan 11 2026
signals.data_point: Part 1 of construction permit application filed for two SMR-300 units (Pioneer 1 and 2) at Palisades site in Michigan. Requests NRC approval by Dec 31, 2026. Part 2 due mid-2027. Construction completion targeted early 2030s. Palisades 800 MW PWR restart (separate from SMRs) postponed from end-2025 to Q1 2026 — would be first US nuclear decommissioning reversal.
signals.relevance: First SMR construction permit application at an existing nuclear site represents regulatory and commercial milestone. If Palisades restarts, it proves nuclear decommissioning is reversible — fundamentally changes asset valuation of every shuttered nuclear plant in the US. Twin SMR approach at existing sites could become the template for nuclear expansion.

signals.headline: US interconnection queue backlog at 2,600 GW with median 5-year wait; PJM capacity auction costs spike 570%
signals.source: Enki AI analysis; University of Chicago Sustainability Dialogue; Engineering News-Record; Interconnection.fyi
signals.data_point: 2,600 GW total US interconnection backlog. Median wait: ~5 years, data centers facing up to 12 years. PJM capacity auction: $2.2B to $14.7B in single year (570% increase). MISO: 170+ GW of solar/wind/storage awaiting interconnection with 4+ year delays. FERC Order 2023 shifting to 'first-ready, first-served' but raising entry barriers.
signals.relevance: The interconnection queue is now the single largest structural bottleneck for both energy transition and AI scaling. PJM's 570% capacity cost spike directly increases electricity prices for 65M people. 12-year data center connection timelines make current AI infrastructure expansion plans physically undeliverable without radical grid reform.

signals.headline: Copper hits record $13,387/tonne on supply disruptions; structural deficit of 330 kmt projected for 2026
signals.source: J.P. Morgan Global Research; Goldman Sachs; Mining.com; International Copper Study Group
signals.data_point: LME copper record: $13,387/tonne (Jan 6), 22% rally from Nov. J.P. Morgan projects 330 kmt global refined copper deficit for 2026. Mine supply growth estimates cut to 1.4% (500 kmt below earlier estimates). Grasberg (Indonesia) force majeure + Quebrada Blanca (Chile) downgrade. US Commerce Dept must report on domestic copper market by June 30; potential 15% universal copper duty from 2027.
signals.relevance: Copper deficit directly constrains energy transition infrastructure (grid buildout, EV production, data center power systems). 330 kmt deficit at record prices signals demand is outrunning supply investment. Potential US copper tariffs would add 15-30% to domestic energy infrastructure costs. Copper is becoming the binding physical constraint on AI scaling.

signals.headline: UC Berkeley report: California data center water use to reach 116B liters by 2028; regulatory framework inadequate
signals.source: UC Berkeley Center for Law, Energy & Environment, Feb 11 2026 — https://www.law.berkeley.edu/research/clee/research/wheeler/water-innovation/data-center-water-use/; Maven's Notebook
signals.data_point: California data center water consumption: ~50B liters (2023), projected 116B liters by 2028 (132% increase). 160+ new AI data centers built in US water-scarce areas in past 3 years. 45% of 9,055 data center facilities may face high water stress exposure by 2050s. Cooling accounts for ~40% of total DC energy use. Microsoft piloting zero-water evaporated cooling designs in 2026.
signals.relevance: Water is emerging as a second binding physical constraint on AI scaling (after electricity). California's projected 132% increase in DC water demand collides with chronic Western drought conditions. Regulatory vacuum (report documents lack of reporting requirements) means no visibility into actual consumption. Zero-water cooling technologies become competitive advantage.

signals.headline: One Big Beautiful Bill Act: renewable energy tax credits restricted, construction deadline set for July 5, 2026
signals.source: SEIA; Latham & Watkins; Stoel Rives; Columbia CGEP; Georgetown Environmental Law Review
signals.data_point: OBBBA (signed Jul 2025) restricts IRA clean energy credits: no 45Y/48E/45X credits for Foreign Entity of Concern recipients from 2026. Construction must begin before July 5, 2026 or be placed in service by Dec 31, 2027 to qualify. Domestic content threshold escalates to 50% (2026), 55% (post-2026). BUT Georgetown analysis argues bill may paradoxically 'supercharge' clean energy by accelerating project timelines to beat deadlines.
signals.relevance: July 5, 2026 construction deadline creates a renewable energy rush-or-stall dynamic. Projects either accelerate to beat the deadline (short-term boom) or defer indefinitely (medium-term bust). FEOC restrictions compound supply chain challenges for solar panels and battery components sourced from China. Reshapes the economics of every utility-scale renewable project in the US.

signals.headline: Moltbook breach exposes 1.6M AI agents' private data; AI-generated code security crisis emerges
signals.source: Information Matters Agentic AI News, Feb 8 2026 — https://informationmatters.net/agentic-ai-news-8-february-2026/
signals.data_point: Moltbook, a social platform for 1.6 million AI agents, exposed private messages and credentials due to poor security. Entire site was built with AI-generated code without human security review. Microsoft developed scanning methods to detect poisoned AI models with hidden backdoor attacks.
signals.relevance: First major breach of an AI-agent platform reveals systemic security risks in agentic AI deployment. AI-generated code without security review creating vulnerabilities at scale validates the trust deficit (46% of developers distrust AI code accuracy). As AI agents proliferate (40% of enterprise apps by year-end), security becomes the critical adoption bottleneck.

cross_force_patterns.description: F1 AI capability acceleration is now physically constrained by F6 bottlenecks: interconnection queue (2,600 GW backlog, 12-year DC wait times), copper deficit (330 kmt, record prices), and water stress (132% increase projected). The gap between AI demand growth and physical infrastructure delivery is widening, not narrowing.

F3 US Critical Minerals Ministerial (54 nations, $10B Project Vault, FORGE alliance) directly responds to F6 copper/mineral constraints on energy transition. Tariff regime (47.5% on Chinese goods) compounds supply chain stress. OBBBA FEOC restrictions further limit mineral sourcing from China. Minerals are the physical substrate where geopolitics meets energy meets AI scaling.

cross_force_patterns.pattern: Adoption-trust divergence across all three forces
cross_force_patterns.description: F1: 84% AI coding adoption but 46% distrust, 19% measured slowdown in RCTs. F3: 85% orgs want agentic enterprise but 76% say processes aren't ready. F6: 15 GW data center capacity leased but nearly none operational. Across all forces, aspiration massively exceeds execution readiness — the structural fear friction gap (T25) is accelerating, not closing.

Meta's 6.6 GW deal, Holtec SMR-300 application, and Palisades restart collectively signal nuclear is being repositioned from legacy energy to AI-era baseload infrastructure. Tech companies are becoming the primary drivers of nuclear expansion for the first time in history.

EU Digital Omnibus delays AI Act high-risk rules to potentially Dec 2027. US SB 53 already enforcing frontier AI frameworks since Jan 1, 2026. India AI Summit (Feb 16-20) proposing Global South governance standards. China's DeepSeek V4 operates under different rules entirely. Four distinct regulatory regimes emerging simultaneously, forcing multinational AI companies into compliance fragmentation.

F1_technology.direction: frontier models converging, agentic deployment scaling, physical AI capital rotating
F1_technology.key_metric: 5% to 40% enterprise AI agent adoption in single year; $13.8B robotics funding (77% YoY)
F1_technology.uncertainty: DeepSeek V4 performance claims unverified; coding productivity paradox unresolved

F3_geopolitics.direction: mineral alliances forming, federal workforce restructuring, regulatory fragmentation
F3_geopolitics.key_metric: 54-nation Critical Minerals Ministerial; 322K federal workers departed; AUKUS ITAR exemption finalized but ETL unchanged
F3_geopolitics.uncertainty: Nov 2026 tariff truce expiration; India AI Summit outcomes unpredictable; DOGE spending paradox unresolved

F6_energy.direction: demand acceleration outpacing supply buildout across electricity, minerals, and water
F6_energy.key_metric: 2,600 GW queue backlog; 330 kmt copper deficit; PJM capacity costs up 570%; 15 GW leased but not online
F6_energy.uncertainty: OBBBA July 2026 deadline creates binary outcomes for renewables; nuclear timeline execution risk (Palisades restart, SMR construction permits)
